name: Sasquatch Sap
description: 3C Sasquatch Sap is a unique and heady sativa, dishing out a strong meditative mental state from the onset that slinks down into the body. The aroma and flavor of this flower’s tightly bound colas are distinctive, leading with a heavy dose of diesel and finishing with tartness on the palate. This strain is a hybrid blend of Chem’s Sister and Chocolate Diesel, doling out semi-stimulating qualities that fill the body with warmth while setting the mind free. Enjoy this strain before physical activity for a complementary body high, or after physical activity to reinvigorate the mind and im-bue the body with an airy lightness.
descriptionPlain: 3C Sasquatch Sap is a unique and heady sativa, dishing out a strong meditative mental state from the onset that slinks down into the body. The aroma and flavor of this flower’s tightly bound colas are distinctive, leading with a heavy dose of diesel and finishing with tartness on the palate. This strain is a hybrid blend of Chem’s Sister and Chocolate Diesel, doling out semi-stimulating qualities that fill the body with warmth while setting the mind free. Enjoy this strain before physical activity for a complementary body high, or after physical activity to reinvigorate the mind and im-bue the body with an airy lightness.

highlightedReviews.text:
Purchased in flower form from downtown LA's Cannabal City Collective (a spot I highly recommend), this is 3C Farms' take on Gorilla Glue #4, and the frosted, fluffy nugs definitely express major diesel fumes and flavor on the palate. I'm not sure why such a chemical-drenched flavor is enticing, but it is, and it's certainly unique among the usual piney Kush and sour fruit varieties populating shelves.

Effects were immediate and strong out of a vaporizer... Sasquatch Sap begins with a buzzy, sativa head high (smiles, pressure around the forehead and cheekbones) but then settles into a kind of meditative, relaxed body buzz. I wouldn't say I was glued to the couch-- I think the "Glue" part of this strain refers to how sticky* it is-- but I did feel fantastically mellow, and the latter half of the high was perfect for watching movies and de-stressing.

To sum up, this is a great strain for stress, anxiety or just unwinding after a long day. But it's not a lazy strain, either, and I'm looking forward to trying it with a workout-- the energy boost on the front end and the relaxation afterward seem like they'd be the perfect pairing. Highly recommend!

*Oh yeah, it's REALLY sticky. Like it was physically difficult to grind, even though my batch was perfectly cured. Intense.

Wouldn’t it be great if we associated specific strains with specific seasons? Like how we associate pumpkin spice with autumn. 

Until then, partake in this sizzlin sativa: It is a perfect springtime strain that will put a SPRING in your step. Ideal for a post-workout shower ‘n bake (and don’t be surprised if you find yourself cleaning out the shower before the body high sets in) 

One note though: The body high is sufficiently high enough (hee) that I don’t recommend working out while high off of this strain. You might ignore a pain signal and get hurt
